Class WRaster

java.lang.Object
us.mn.state.dot.tms.utils.wysiwyg.WRaster
Direct Known Subclasses:
WRasterClassic, WRasterColor24, WRasterMono1, WRasterMono8
public abstract class WRaster extends Object
WRaster - Base Graphic class used for imaging WYSIWYG-rendered MULTI strings. (Parts of this class are structured similarly to the method-outline used for the earlier RasterGraphic, BitmapGraphic, and PixmapGraphic classes.) One of the 4 WRaster subclasses is obtained by calling one of the WRaster.create methods. Do not create an instance of a WRaster subclass directly. WRaster saves the pixels in a form (based on MULTI tag values) that can be easily converted to a basic multi-page BufferedImage, a WYSIWYG edit- image, or an NTCIP ColorScheme-specific byte-array. For purposes of this class and derived sub-classes, a color can be represented in several different ways: tagval = int-array containing 1 -OR- 3 values. pixel = a single-int representation of a tagval DmsColor = frequently used Iris color class
Author:
John L Stanley - SRF Consulting Group

    • copy

      public void copy(WRaster wg, int x0, int y0)
      Copy a WRaster into this WRaster. Black pixels in the graphic being copied are considered transparent.
      Parameters:
      wg - WRaster to copy.
      x0 - X-position on raster (0-based).
      y0 - Y-position on raster (0-based).

    • copy

      public void copy(WRaster wg, int x0, int y0, int fg)
      Copy a WRaster into this WRaster. Black pixels in the raster being copied are considered transparent. Non-black pixels are placed in the target as the foreground pixel value fg.
      Parameters:
      wg - WRaster to copy.
      x0 - X-position on raster (0-based).
      y0 - Y-position on raster (0-based).
      fg - Foreground pixel color.

    • drawSolidBox

      public void drawSolidBox(int pix, int x0, int y0, int w, int h)
      Draw a solid (filled-in) box onto the WRaster.
      Parameters:
      pix - pixel color of the box.
      x0 - X-position on raster (0-based).
      y0 - Y-position on raster (0-based).
      w - Width of box
      h - Height of box

      public Integer tagvalToBgPixel(int[] tagval)
      Convert a tagval to a background pixel value If tagval is null, returns the default background color. If tagval is invalid, returns null.

    • tagvalToPixel2

      protected abstract Integer tagvalToPixel2(int[] tagval)
      Convert a tagval to a pixel value. Returns null if tagval can't be converted for this raster.

    • classicColorToPixel

      public abstract Integer classicColorToPixel(int cco)
      Convert a classic-color int to a pixel int. Returns null if specific classic-color value can't be converted for this raster.

    • setWysiwygImageSize

      public void setWysiwygImageSize(int pixWidth, int pixHeight) throws InvalidMsgException
      Set width/height for WISIWIG sign-image. (Generates horizontal and vertical coordinate-mapping arrays.) In the following, "pix" variables contain the number of bitmap pixels used to draw something (width or height) in the WYSIWIG sign-image.
      Parameters:
      pixWidth - desired sign-image width (in pixels)
      pixHeight - desired sign-image height (in pixels)
      Throws:
      InvalidMsgException

    • isWysiwygInitialized

      public boolean isWysiwygInitialized()
      Return whether or not the WYSIWYG image size has been set.

    • getWysiwygImage

      public BufferedImage getWysiwygImage()
      Generate WYSIWYG-editor image. (Uses size set by setWysiwygImageSize(...))

    • cvtWysiwygToSignX

      public int cvtWysiwygToSignX(int x) throws IndexOutOfBoundsException
      Convert horizontal WYSIWIG coordinate to a sign-tag coordinate. If the x coordinate points to a non-LED part of the image, this returns the closest LED coordinate.
      Parameters:
      x - 0-based horizontal image coordinate
      Returns:
      1-based horizontal sign-tag coordinate
      Throws:
      IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the setWysiwygImageSize method has not been called

    • cvtSignToWysiwygX

      public int cvtSignToWysiwygX(int x, boolean first, boolean sep) throws IndexOutOfBoundsException
      Convert horizontal sign-tag coordinate to WYSIWYG coordinates. Returns either the first or last WYSIWYG X coordinate assigned to the given sign-tag coordinate. If the coordinate is invalid, -1 is returned.
      Parameters:
      x - 1-based horizontal sign-tag coordinate
      first - if true, return first matching coordinate, otherwise last
      sep - return coordinate of LED separators around sign instead of LEDs themselves
      Returns:
      The WYSIWYG coordinate.
      Throws:
      IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the setWysiwygImageSize method has not been called

    • cvtWysiwygToSignY

      public int cvtWysiwygToSignY(int y) throws IndexOutOfBoundsException
      Convert vertical WYSIWIG coordinate to a sign-tag coordinate. If the y coordinate points to a non-LED part of the image, this returns the closest LED coordinate.
      Parameters:
      y - 0-based vertical image coordinate
      Returns:
      1-based vertical sign-tag coordinate
      Throws:
      IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the setWysiwygImageSize method has not been called

    • cvtSignToWysiwygY

      public int cvtSignToWysiwygY(int y, boolean first, boolean sep) throws IndexOutOfBoundsException
      Convert vertical sign-tag coordinate to WYSIWYG coordinates - convenience method. Returns either the first or last WYSIWYG Y coordinate assigned to the given sign-tag coordinate. If the coordinate is invalid, -1 is returned.
      Parameters:
      y - 1-based horizontal sign-tag coordinate
      first - if true, return first matching coordinate, otherwise last
      sep - return coordinate of LED separators around sign instead of LEDs themselves
      Returns:
      The WYSIWYG coordinate.
      Throws:
      IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the setWysiwygImageSize method has not been called
